column1: length ball angling into him, tries to flick it, it goes off his pad to square leg
nice line, too close to off stump and to his body to cut, he tries to do it and misses. And the ball has died on Hope and pinged him on the inside of  his left knee behind the stumps.
swing into the left-hander, yorker length, defended solidly back down the pitch
keeping it on off stump, and getting it to nibble in the air. Zazai checks his push without moving feet and it hits the inside half of the bat to roll back towards the bowler's left
loses his line and it's too far down leg
and the off-cutter has sent Zazai back. Bowled on a length but it's not at normal pace, and Zazai clearly didn't read it. Too early into the cut shot and it just loops to cover off the outside edge
length on the stumps, nudged into the legside
length ball outside off, Gurbaz goes for the cut but too far away from him
length ball around off, nice seam position from Holder. Tapped it towards covers
length around off and moving away a little bit off the seam. Gurbaz looks to smash it over the top but finds thin air
short of length outside off, rises with the bounce and dabs it towards third man
bowled wide of the crease, angling in on to the pads, looks to flick but misses. Hit on the thigh
length ball around off and coming in with the angle once again. Janat was stuck in the crease and gets hit on the knee roll this time. Would have gone down though
length ball outside off, stays leg side of the ball and pushes it towards covers
length ball on the pads, a bit of shape back into the right-hander. Gurbaz misses the flick and is rapped just above the knee roll
length around middle and off this time, Gurbaz frees his arms and swings it towards midwicket, one-bounce four
slower, length ball around off, stays on the leg stump and steers it towards cover-point

short of length this time and Gurbaz once again goes for the pull. The ball hurries on to him, hits high on the bat. Lewis puts in the jump at short midwicket but doesn't time it well and ball goes just over him
fuller and wider outside off, Janat drives it through extra cover, Keemo Paul with the chase

fuller and wider outside off, Janat clears his front leg and looks to smash through the off side once again but manages only an outside edge this time. An easy catch for Hope, the second wicket for Cottrell
length ball around off, Gurbaz moves across and hits it over fine leg with a pick-up pull, first six of the evening
a full toss at the stumps this time but Gurbaz fails to get his timing right. Ends up bunting it down towards Holder
early into the shot this time. Was a length ball around off, Gurbaz went for another pull but ended up toe-ending it towards covers
a low full toss at the batsman, hits it along the ground towards long-on
length ball outside off, stays beside the line and pushes it towards point
length ball around fifth stump, moves across a bit and defends late
short of length angling across the batsman, steers it towards short third man
short of length outside off, looks to cut it through extra cover but doesn't get the timing right
short of length, backs away but the bowler follows him. Gurbaz nonetheless goes for it and pulls it towards deep midwicket for four
a sharp bouncer this time, whizzed past Gurbaz who pulled out of the pull. Called a wide for height though
lands just short of Keemo Paul at mid-off. Length ball around off, looks to go over mid-off but gets the timing wrong. Paul moves forward and to his left but it falls in front of him
fuller outside off, aims to smash it over deep midwicket but cannot connect
fuller on the stumps, flicked towards midwicket but Pollard himself is stationed there now and keeps it to one
fuller outside off and it's lofted over long-on in a very casual manner. Was an offcutter but it didn't matter for Gurbaz
fuller on the pads, tucked away behind square leg, two is the call but Hetmyer is quick to the ball and prevents the second run
length ball angling on to the stumps, gets behind the line and blocks
length ball once again, on middle and leg, pushes it towards short midwicket
fuller outside off, pushes it towards cover from the back foot but straight towards the fielder
fuller around off, comes forward and pushes, towards extra cover this time
fuller but down the leg side, Gurbaz goes for the sweep but misses. Hope too can make only a partial stop
fuller around off, comes forward and pushes it towards the bowler
length ball on the stumps, dances down the track, takes on the long-on fielder and clears him by quite some distance. His third six of the innings
flatter and quicker around off, Gurbaz stays back and punches it towards long-off
length ball around off, goes back and punches it towards the bowler
a touch fuller on the pads, pushed towards the non-striker in search of quick single but Pierre was quick to move across
length ball on the stumps, comes forward and blocks. Nine balls and yet to get off the mark
length ball outside off, steers it towards third man for one
finally off the mark, off his tenth delivery. Short of length around off, walks forward and drops it on the off side for a quick single

Holder hits the stumps direct at the bowler's end, Ibrahim was halfway down the track and had no chance to get back. Was a fuller one on the stumps, Gurbaz missed the flick but tried to sneak in a leg-bye, Ibrahim committed before his partner said no. Holder moved across quickly, fielded the ball and nailed the direct hit
length ball outside off, works it towards third man
short of length around off, Asghar was on the front foot and ended up fending at it. Whizzed past him
short of length again but doesn't rise much this time, pulled towards deep midwicket where Brandon King fumbled and allowed the second run
a full toss outside off, Gurbaz moves across and places it towards wide long-on
length ball on the stumps, goes back and flicks it towards square leg
skips down the pitch but Pierre fires it on the pads. Flicked towards midwicket. Fifty comes up for Afghanistan
fuller outside off, lunges forward and blocks
short of length outside. Asghar finds extra cover with the cut
short and wide, cuts it towards sweeper cover this time
fuller outside off, leans forward and drives it towards long-off
fuller on the stumps, backs away and smashes it past the bowler. The long-off fielder was up in the circle and had no chance to even move
an offcutter, short of length outside off. Gurbaz waits for it before ramping it over the keeper for back-to-back fours
short of length around off, looks to drop and run but the ball doesn't go anywhere. Decides against his decision after seeing Holder charging down the wicket
short of length outside off, steers it towards third man
short of length outside off, moves across and flicks it towards midwicket. The fielder is deep and that allows the batsmen ton come back for the second
a full toss down the leg side, Gurbaz goes for the sweep but misses out as it hits him on the arm. The umpire calls it a wide to everyone's surprise but changes his decision immediately afterwards
short and wide outside off, cut powerfully but there is deep extra cover in place
short and wide outside off, spinning further away. Asghar was looking to skip down the ground first but then stays in the crease. A wide this time
fuller around off, worked towards long-on for one
short and wide outside off, cuts it towards sweeper cover
length ball on the pads, flicked away towards midwicket
tossed up outside off teasingly. Gurbaz looks to push at it and is overbalanced a bit. The back foot lifts up for a moment but is back grounded when the bails come off. Not out, rules third umpire
fuller outside off, nice-looking cover drive but extra cover moves quickly to field
fuller on the pads, clipped nicely away through midwicket to raise a fine fifty for Gurbaz. It's been an innings full of bold strokes, and he didn't let early wickets rattle him
fuller on leg again, nudged to midwicket
full outside off, punched to point
low full toss on leg stump, makes room and clips to long-on
too short, sits up a bit and he smears a pull from below his waist to deep square leg
length ball angling into him, he shuffles across and tucks it fine
saw the batsman making room and followed him, cramped him for room and he could only bunt it to short square leg for a quick single
another slower ball, length outside off, beats Asghar completely, who is left feeling for it, with bat dragged away from body
normal pace, back of a length ball coming into him on off stump, defended off his toes towards cover for a quick single

moved very far across the stumps, ended up on the fifth stump trying to smack it over fine leg. Williams bowled an inswinger that would have been a wide if the batsman was on off stump, but given how far he had moved across, a bit harsh to get wided for that
this time it's clearly down leg with the batsman static, and a clear wide

Williams can't believe that has not been given out. Slower off-cutter and the batsman is foxed totally, ends up with bat in front of body pushing at air while the ball nips back to hit pad. But the umpire has a point, it may have missed leg. The ball rolled fine to third man for two leg byes
length ball on leg, moves inside the line to tuck it to square leg. Didn't hit it hard which allowed them enough time to come back for two

dropped by Brand King at deep square leg. Asghar went deep in his crease to get underneath the ball. No pace from Paul and he lifts it high towards deep square. Straight into King's hands who was taking a few steps back, and straight out. Rolls over the boundary moreover.
slower ball outside off, no pace on it again and Asghar misses connecting with the cut
doesn't matter who the fielder is if he hits them like that. Moved across and stayed still, then absolutely whacked this, lifting it off his pads and over deep backward square leg, into the stands

and Paul has his revenge. Digs in a short ball at pace on off, after having slowed it up earlier. Gets big on Asghar who tries to hook it. Gets a top edge trying to hook. And who should it go to but the newly placed King at square leg, who gratefully accepts the catch this time
length on the stumps, steered to third man by opening the face
too short, sits up and doesn't bounce, to a man in Gurbaz's form that's fodder. He transfers weight back and smacks a pull shot with power, sends it racing to the deep square leg fence
going across him, makes him reach for the shot, goes off the toe end towards mid-off
closer to the stumps and slightly shorter length than the previous ball, allows him to open the face and steer it to third man
well executed pull shot, even though he didn't get it completely in the sweet spot. Short ball outside off, moves slightly across and pulls to long on's right. Well placed and they get two
he's going 360 degrees. Goes down on one knee and sweeps it over short fine leg from outside off to find the boundary
slower one on the stumps, pushed towards mid-on
slower one, fullish outside off, he was moving across to heave it on the onside, but too early into the shot and the ball goes under the bat to the keeper

tried to fool the bowler by making as if to give himself room and then goes well across. Williams can't believe it's been called a wide again, and he has a point. This was just past leg stump, and looked further away from the batsman because of how much across he had gone.
disdainful. Stays still this time and Williams bowls it slightly back of a length on the stumps. He clears his front leg and frees his arms to smack a pull over deep midwicket.

ooooh that's going to sting. Gurbaz is down, having been hit on the box. Moved across and tried to slog a full toss over backward square. Missed and the ball's hit him painfully. He's down on the ground now and getting treatment.

yorker on off, dug back out to the bowler. He's not able to stop it cleanly, and they steal a quick single. It went off Williams to the non-striker's boot while he was running. Not intentional, though Williams is not happy they've taken a single
good bowling, another yorker on the stumps, squirted back out to the bowler's right and Williams throws himself to his right in his follow through to save the ball
slower ball, going across him, steered to short third man
slower ball on the stumps, patted into the legside
full toss on middle stump, and he flicks it high and mighty over deep square

short and wide outside off, Gurbaz makes excellent connection having to reach for it, but it flies off his slashing shot straight to deep point who is positioned exactly where the ball went. End of a fine innings
length ball on the stumps, nudged to long-on
full on leg, down on one knee and slog-sweeps it very fine for a one-bounce four. Great connection and audacious execution
mixes it up by bowling it wide of off stump, going across the left-hander. Within the tram-lines so that won't be wide. The batsmen not happy with that, but that was probably not a wide
this one will be a wide, for height though. Dug it in very short and it bounces well over the batsman's head
slower ball angling into him, tucked to midwicket
took the pace off and kept it on a tight channel outside off. The batsman tries to steer it and misses
short-arm jab pull shot to long-on's left. Not quite short or wide enough to free his arms, but he did well wit the execution of the shot there
that's outta here. This was shorter and he was on the backfoot in a flash, unleashes a fierce pull that sends the ball soaring over deep midwicket

good follow up by Cottrell, who swings in a yorker at pace. The batsman misses the flick and it flies off the pad for a leg-bye. Cottrell thinks that's close enough to be given out, but perhaps was sliding down

Brand King misfields at short fine leg. Not a great ball, back of a length on leg stump, Nabi moves inside the line and connects well with his paddle-sweep. The ball's travelling quickly and King can't collect cleanly

length on the stumps, flicked through midwicket. They sprint for their lives and complete the second, even though the fielder swooped in and released the ball quickly. Cottrell though couldn't collect cleanly at the non-striker's end

spliced off the leading edge to a very straight long-on. Slower yorker, Najibullah was looking to go deep and create momentum to flick it over midwicket, ends up getting a leading edge that loops comfortably to the fielder
smoked. That's what Najib was trying to do, and Nabi does it. Goes deep and gets underneath this yorker length ball, to drive it straight and true, over long-off. Stunning
punched to long-on
slower ball, back of a length outside off, he looks to give himself room but slashes it straight to backward point
digs in a bouncer first up at normal pace, Naib is a bit late on the pull but gets an under-edge that rolls towards point
slower ball, length on the stumps, he shuffles across, waits for it and taps it towards square leg. Takes a single to retain strike
didn't get hold of this one. Fuller length outside off, he was moving across and generating momentum with a big bat swing, but gets it off the toe-end of the bat for an easy catch to long-on
low full toss outside off, goes for an expansive drive but it takes a thick inside edge to short fine leg
tried some innovation. Moved across and tried to scoop it over third man. Gets a light touch on it and it bounces in front of the keeper, who has moved to his right and stops it
full outside off, steers it through point
slower ball, well wide of off stump, he stays still and reaches out to slash this through point
fuller on off, moves across to try and smack it over midwicket but no timing and it rolls along the ground to long-on
length ball outside off, goes back and looks to cut but misses
length but down the leg side, called a wide
fuller outside off, goes for the drive but finds mid-off
slower in the air, in the pads. Simmons fails to connect the flick
fuller outside off, a big stride forward and defended towards cover-point
short of length outside off, Simmons once again fails to connect the cut
fuller and drifting on to the pads, flicked away towards backward square leg. Simmons is off the mark
short of length around off, punched off the back foot towards extra cover
short and wide outside off, Simmons goes back and gives himself some room before employing a fierce cut past point
slower length ball on the stumps, flicked away towards square leg. The fielder throws at the keeper's end and pings Lewis on the right ankle
and hits his first ball for four. It was short and wide and he slashes it over point
length ball around off and middle, swivels around to pull it towards deep square leg
a dipping full toss outside off, Simmons hits it hard but only a single to mid-on

bowled 'im with a googly. Was slower in the air for a change, a length ball around off. Simmons went for the cut but was early into the shot and missed. The ball clattered into the off and middle stump
length ball around off, stays back and defends
fuller around off, drives it from the front foot to the left of mid-off for a quick single
a carrom ball around off and middle. Lewis comes forward and blocks
length ball around off, stays back and punches it towards long-on
fuller around off, comes forward and pushes towards mid-off
length ball on middle and leg, Lewis moves across a bit and taps it towards short fine leg
length ball outside off, a slower one. Lewis goes for the cut but ends up chopping it towards the keeper
length outside off, Lewis goes for another cut but too close to him this time. Chopped towards extra cover for a quick single
length ball outside off, cuts it towards point
bowls him with a slower one. Was a length ball around off, King didn't pick it up and was early into the shot, pushing at it. Missed and the ball clattered into the stumps
fuller around off, comes forward and drives it towards mid-off
fuller on the stumps, comes forward and drives it towards long-on
fuller but down the leg side, Lewis cannot connect the sweep. The umpire doesn't call it a wide though
length ball around off, goes for the cut but ends up chopping it into the ground
another carrom ball, Lewis defends it from the back foot
carrom ball on the stumps, goes back and punches it towards the bowler
a full toss on the leg stump this time, and Lewis half-sweeps half-pulls it over short fine leg
length ball on the stumps, punched towards short midwicket for a quick single
fuller around off, comes forward and drives it towards extra cover where the fielder makes a partial stop, diving to his left, and deflects it the ball towards mid-off
fuller, straying on the pads. Hope flicks it towards deep-backward square leg
a beamer, right at the batsman. Slipped from the bowler's hand who apologies immediately. Lewis just drops down to the ground to protect himself
fuller on the stumps, Lewis clears his front leg and smashes it back past the bowler for four
a slower one, length outside off, dabs it towards short third man and sets off for a quick single
another slower one. Fuller outside off, and driven towards mid-off for another scampering single
length ball around off, comes forward and punches it towards extra cover
length, a bit of width as well. Stands tall and smashes but fails to beat extra cover once again
a full toss wide outside off, Hope drives it towards sweeper cover but only a single
slower length ball on the stumps, Lewis turns it towards short fine leg
gives charge but Gulbadin slips in a yorker. Hope manages to get his bat on it and completes a single to short third man
slower length ball outside off, pulls it towards deep square leg
slower one, fuller outside off, Lewis goes for the cut but gets a thick outside edge that bounces well in front of short third man
fuller on the stumps, almost a yorker, flicked away in front of square leg

slower length ball around off, Lewis goes for the pull but ends up top-edging it towards deep midwicket. Rashid was a bit inside the boundary line and had to pedal back a bit. He catches it but had to flick it back with the momentum taking him over the boundary line. But no one is around to pick up the ball, Gulbadin eventually realises and sends in the throw
a full toss around off, bunts it towards long-off for one
fuller outside off, another slower one. Looks to drill down the ground but mistimes it towards long-on

length ball around off, goes for the pull but misses and is hit on the pads. An appeal for lbw and given. Lewis doesn't look happy but it hit him in front of off and middle and would have gone on to hit the middle and leg. He collided with the bowler as well who was just turning around after appealing
fuller on the pads, tucked away towards backward square leg
length ball on the stumps, pulled towards midwicket to get off the mark
length ball on the stumps, adjusts to the change of pace and lofts it over the bowler's head. Hares back for the second
dropped. Short of length around off, Hope stands tall and lofts it down the ground once again. Naveen at long-on with the chance, settles under but spills while tumbling
fuller on the stumps, flicked towards midwicket
fuller and straying on the pads, clipped away towards deep midwicket for a couple
short of length outside off, cuts it towards sweeper cover where Janat lets it go through under his hands
length ball around off, punched towards extra cover
length around off, goes back and cuts it towards sweeper cover. Janat keeps it to one this time
length ball around off, Hope goes back and pulls it over deep midwicket, all the way for a six
a low full toss at the stumps, smashed but straight back towards the bowler
another low full toss on the pads, flicked towards deep midwicket. Rashid charges towards the ball but Hetmyer is haring down for the second and makes it easily
Flat on the stumps, slog-sweeps to deep midwicket, but not timed well
slider on off, he plays it from the back foot, pushing to mid-on for a quick single
googly this time, played from deep in his crease, clipped off the pads to square
down the track and driven back, but off the toe end and Rashid fields

drags it down a bit short, and he's able to rock back and pull this by opening his shoulders, sending it straight back. Good work by Gulbadin, running in and saving the boundary at a very straight long-on
flat on off, flat-batted to long-on
angling into him from slightly wide of the crease, almost yorker length. He wanted to hit it straight but the inward movement beats him and strikes his pad
slower ball and very wide of off stump. That was clever bowling, but incredibly, it's been wided! That was inside the tram lines. Very harsh on Janat
this is some smart bowling by Janat. Follows the one wide of off with a yorker on off, moving in, doesn't allow any room for Hope to drive it, and he can only pat it away towards point
normal pace this time, angling into him from around the wicket, and he bunts it back past the bowler to mid-off

through point's legs. length ball outside off, he steers it away, but the man at point lets it go through. Bad bit of fielding. Asghar Afghan, who was nearby, hares after it and slides to pull it in before it reaches the third man boundary. But his valiant effort is in vain, because his hands touched the boundary rope while pulling the ball back in. Asghar is not happy with that call. He reckons he had pulled it back in safely. And he has a point. The umpiring has been very questionable in this game.
fuller outside off, a flowing cover drive, but it goes straight to cover
angling into him, tucked off his pads while off balance between deep midwicket and long-on
googly foxes him completely. Went down on one knee to slog-sweep it into oblivion, but it turns past bat and turns past the keeper too
down the track, gets to the pitch, but can't time his heave well, and it rolls to long-on off the inside half of the bat
another googly does it. This was a bit flatter, outside off and Hetmyer was giving himself room to carve it over extra cover. Ends up with a leading edge that lobs up to point
quicker, flatter and shorter, he jabs it away to midwicket having gone on the back foot
nice drift but ends up a bit overpitched and Pollard works it to midwicket
good length outside off, Hope lunges well forward and pushes it with bat still a bit in front of pad to long-on
fuller outside off, crunches a cover drive to the man on the sweeper boundary
walking down the track, Naib spots it and not only shortens the length but takes off the pace, and all Pollard can do is tickle it to short fine leg
yorker, swinging into him, but Hope has dealt with it extremely well. Flicked it fine while off balance and beats short fine leg
slower ball, but short of a length, he waits for it and slaps a pull to deep midwicket
down the track again, Naib bowls it back of a length and rolls his fingers over it, and Pollard has no pace to work with. Pulls it from chest high, gets an under-edge to short fine leg
excellent stop by Rashid at cover. This was a crisp cover drive off a rare loose ball, in the slot and at normal pace, and Hope timed it well but Rashid dived to his right and stopped the ball
beaten. Classic leggie, that dips, grips and turns past the bat while drawing him forward. He's kept his back leg rooted to the crease though, so he won't be stumped
quicker, length ball on off, turning away, pushed to cover
drags it down short but keeps it wide of off, and the batsman can only toe-end a pull to deep midwicket
fuller on the stumps, worked to deep midwicket off the front foot. Excellent running by Hope to come to the danger end for a second run
another beauty that spins past Pollard's outside edge while he's pushing at it
googly, but too short, allows him to go back and pull to long-on. Not timed well
goes very wide of the crease and angles it into him on a length. He was looking to go more legside but ends up to long-on off the inside half of the bat
lovely shot. that's Hope's class. Slower ball, he got in position early but waited for it, and unleashed a free flowing smack down the ground off a horizontal bat
good comeback, yorker from wide of the crease that he rams into the ground and back to the bowler
superb bowling. Pin point yorker, tailing into middle stump. He can only dig it out back to the bowler
goes very wide of the crease again, slower ball on a length, flat batted to long-off
down the track, converts this to a leg stump half volley and flicks it to deep backward square leg
that's a monster leggie. Pitched on a length outside off, and spat up while turning considerably
another dot ball, patted towards cover
goes down on one knee and slaps it hard, but not timed or placed well. Goes to long-off. fifty for Hope who barely acknowledges it
beauty. He thought it was the googly and was playing inside the line, instead it spins past the bat as he's lunging forward
unlucky for Rashid. Beats him all ends up with a googly that Pollard had no clue about. Turned a long, long way, clipped his pad and runs down for four

excellent fielding by Nabi at long-on. Pollard pulled out the agricultural slog, taking it from outside off and muscling it wide of long-on. Nabi runs and stretches out a hand to push it back and prevent a boundary
back of a length outside off, goes back and mis-times his pull to long-on's left

caught at deep midwicket. That is a crucial, crucial wicket. Pollard has the game and the power to take the pitch out of the equation. It looked like he made good connection here too. He had moved across and picked this up from outside off, flicking it with strong wrists. Didn't get enough to clear the man, it was the longer boundary.
normal pace, full and wide outside off. Holder flashes his bat at it, but can't connect
tailing into him from slightly wide of the crease, flicked with the angle to deep midwicket
slower ball, yorker length almost and wide of off stump. Makes Hope reach for it, he cannot get any timing on it and plays it along the ground to long-on with a horizontal bat
finds the gap. Slower ball dug in short, Holder uses his strength to muscle a pull between deep midwicket and long-on

floated up a wide yorker outside off, and Hope had no option but to throw his bat at it. Doesn't meet it on the sweet spot, and ends up hitting straight to Asghar at extra cover. He holds it reverse cup in front of his face
too far outside off and he'll have to rebowl that
another slower ball well outside off, he's moved across a bit but still can only get it off the end of his bat, smearing it to long-on
full outside off, driven to long-off
slower ball, back of a length. The batsman had no clue about it. Had completed his pull shot by the time the ball went past his off stump
another slower ball, brilliantly bowled. Wide of off this time, but rolled his hands over it so much it died on the way to the keeper. The flailing bat was nowhere near ball
tries to do it again but loses his radar, this time it's too far outside off and it's a wide
yorker on the seventh stump, he moves across and can only pat it to long-on
yorker tailing into him at normal pace, driven to long-off

picks out long-on. Slower ball on the seventh stump, he went for the heave, didn't time it. Got enough on it to travel all the way to long-on, but there was a fielder positioned there and it was an easy catch for him
full toss, he moves across and flicks it to deep midwicket
another slower ball, on a length and well outside off. Wild slog attempted, connected only with air
off cutter, banged into the pitch, he waits for it and pulls it to the man at deep square leg
and he'll have to rebowl that, so that's a bit of an anti climax. Went around the wicket and tailed too far into him to go down leg
and he finishes it with a slower ball that dies on the keeper even as it goes past his attempted agricultural heave. Fitting way to finish. Afghanistan have won the series.
